title: Sonia Cheadle
content:
Would like to know the typeface used.

Posted previously, someone said it is Silica. But it doesn’t look quite like it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175955im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/homepage_4690.gif)

 [‹ Low Life typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49111 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sky's Stanley Kubrick Season Ad ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49059 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Cypher

comments.content: A light slab serif is needed. Register Serif is close, I think, though not exact.
I’m wondering if it is custom made.

It’s hard to tell at that size, but I think the body copy is Lubalin Graph.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-lubalin-graph/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175955/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-lubalin-graph/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-lubalin-graph/")

It’s [Silica](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201175955/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/silica_extra_light/?sample_text=SONIA%20CHEADLE%20LONDON&sample_size=32), one of my favorite underused slabs.
I’m still sticking by the body text being Lubalin Graph... just look at that capital R.
Yes, you are correct. I am speaking of only the large type.
Ah, no wonder. Was wondering why the body text looks different. Thanks for clarifying.
Ah, no wonder. Was wondering why the body text looks different. Thanks for clarifying.
